channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: George Saunders on a fine method of making sure the students and teacher share the responsibility for guiding the learning. https://t.co/Xwo85Fp2QY

"The first thing I’ll usually do is...ask the students to propose question or issues that we want to be sure to address. I’ll stand at the board and record these. The point is to make sure that the talking I do [addresses concerns] they’ve actually had." https://t.co/RsloTtyN3z
Hoosier GOP legislators may have perfected a system for not having to listen to women. https://t.co/ZWY1ji13X9

“Stevens captures how the Republican Party spent decades cultivating grievances that it didn’t plan to do anything about, while Miller captures the consequent emotional valence, with its ‘unseriousness and cruelty,’” writes @JenSzalai. https://t.co/NRST6j0GGU
Far-right Proud Boys disrupt Pride Month children’s storytime event at South Bend’s Tutt Library. https://t.co/atMNQq2BNT

I asked at the front desk. The person there said that Martin's does not have any policy about bringing guns into the store. Since then I have been thinking about changing to another grocery store. https://t.co/3Njtpa8vNt
My understanding is that a business in Indiana can prohibit customers from bringing in guns if it chooses to do so. I'd like to ask whether @martinsmarkets will make customers safer by doing so?

A few weeks ago at the nearest Martin's grocery store in South Bend a person was walking in the aisles with a handgun in a holster. This made me very uncomfortable. I have no way of knowing the person's intentions or state of mind or even proper gun training. @martinsmarkets
More regional coverage of this week's disruption by Proud Boys of an event at Tutt Library in South Bend. https://t.co/HIUTLY2gjm
More regional reporting about a group of "Proud Boys" disrupting an event at South Bend's Tutt Library. https://t.co/wemNb5Iu2g

Carrying and giving birth to a child is difficult, dangerous, and even traumatic. Carrying the child of one's abuser after rape or incest is akin to psychological abuse. Certain medical conditions can lead to a woman's death early or late in pregnancy or after giving birth.
In Indiana, the gerrymandered GOP Statehouse supermajority is said to be considering denying women those three reasons for abortion. If so, they'd be saying that they'd like women to face those risks without having any choice of terminating pregnancy.
The gerrymandered supermajority means that the Indiana GOP will likely make its decision without even conversing with Democratic lawmakers, and probably without public hearings. They would consider themselves wise enough to make these life-and-death judgments for others.

So we see that members of the Secret Service were plainly assisting. Members of the Secret Service were plainly assisting. Members of the Secret Service were plainly assisting. Plainly assisting. Plainly assisting. Plainly assisting.
According to the lore, after the 1960s California no longer built public spaces and buildings on their university campuses that were suitable for holding rallies, marches, and protests.
There should a week-long unit in school each year detailing the reasons you can’t hope to change the world and exploring times when those reasons were wrong. https://t.co/Kq1BMVSlwb
The thread tells the story of arriving at these values. https://t.co/pWgCNJgnfJ
"The expressive act of making a mark and hanging it in a space is always political." --Sam Gilliam https://t.co/VZdue1v0pS https://t.co/Ybhziad30A
@davewiner I had zero green, zero yellow on my first two rows today. Still, that's information.
Walorski is all slogan, all the time. If @RepWalorski had a credible source for the "views" behind these slogans, she's link to them. https://t.co/BaHxV3iiHM

"That would have been a good time for us to take out everything from the Constitution that was put there to protect slavery, and when you look . . what you will see is practically the whole thing is all about slavery and about protecting the rights of people to own other people."
That's at 13:05 in the podcast. Link and sources:
https://t.co/BWtDOIm8mb
How activism works, and how it fails. A digest created from several historical episodes. https://t.co/Dr3Fgt60WH
“We are a Famous Brand. Our motor lasts for decades but our bowl just lasts for years. We DO NOT sell replacement parts.” https://t.co/JxZitgDEDA
Democratic Party Too much Clark Kent, not enough phone booth. https://t.co/QD1QGKWw1h
. . . when they can get it. https://t.co/Y1CeTYCR1n
Greg Judy, from central Missouri, talks about the real chances for a healthy family and farm life with James Rebanks, @HerdyShepherd1. https://t.co/YWnS7SvzFX
@herdyshepherd1 Go, Missouri . . .

Tucker Carlson is now casually throwing around the word “Stalinist” in his Fox show’s propaganda. Wikipedia: “In 1934, Stalin used the murder of Sergey Kirov as a pretext to launch the Great Purge, in which about a million people perished.” https://t.co/rZs6pq3td4 https://t.co/twxbQjc39Q
